fields.description:
*Assessment*

Per the fix applied for EUCA-9014, any DNS queries to Eucalyptus DNS are not logged if cloud logging properties are changed to DEBUG.  

# Set Cloud Logging to DEBUG
{code}
euca-modify-property -p cloud.euca_log_level=DEBUG
{code}
# Run a tail of all the cloud logs under /var/log/eucalyptus on the CLC:
{code}
tail -f /var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-*.log | grep -i resolv | grep -i dns
{code}
# Query against the Eucalyptus DNS server running on the CLC:
{code}
$ nslookup 10.104.7.12 10.104.10.55
Server:		10.104.10.55
Address:	10.104.10.55#53

12.7.104.10.in-addr.arpa	name = euca-10-104-7-12.future.future.euca-hasp.cs.prc.eucalyptus-systems.com.
{code}
# No log messages seen on the CLC regarding DNS returning information about the lookup:
{code}
[root@odc-f-13 ~]# tail -f /var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-*.log | grep -i resolv | grep -i dns
Wed Oct 1 05:33:04 2014 DEBUG [org.hibernate.engine.internal.TwoPhaseLoad:Eucalyptus.bootstrap:ListenerRegistry:listenerTasks.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#6059] Resolving associations for [com.eucalyptus.loadbalancing.LoadBalancerDnsRecord#8ae88ab74884162801489e27442b308c]

{code}

This is a HUGE issue, and should be fixed ASAP.  The only way to get any helpful information is by using tools like tcpdump or ngrep to see information on the wire.

*Steps*

# Set up Eucalyptus 4.0.1 Cloud with Eucalyptus DNS enabled
# Change cloud log level from INFO to DEBUG
# Monitor cloud logs to see query is not recorded

*Pertinent Data*

In previous versions of Eucalyptus, setting the cloud log level to DEBUG would show the DNS messages regarding resolution.  If this is different post 4.0.0, please provide information as to what log level should this be set to if a cloud administrator would like to triage Eucalyptus DNS.
fields.summary: No ability to enable logging for Eucalyptus DNS

comments.body: [~spark], [~kedwards]  The logging that was in euca 3.4 was removed in com.eucalyptus.util.dns.DnsResolvers.java from the methods findRecords and lookupRecords in euca 4.0; I assume this was done for performance reasons. Do we want to add the logging back for both methods or just lookupRecords?
[~mmunn1] I'd revert the last part of this commit : https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/commit/489bca8581e5f3617869e9ccf9dc945433d5de9b
[~spark] Got it just in the lookupRecords  add back LOG.debug( "DnsResolver: " + RequestType.typeOf( type ) + " " + name );

To reproduce:
Set up Eucalyptus 4.0.2 Cloud with Eucalyptus DNS enabled
Change cloud log level from INFO to DEBUG
Run nslookup ${CLC IP) from running euclyptus instance
Check logs  /var/log/eucalyptus/grep DnsResolver: * 

sample grep output with dns logging added:
{code}
[d-31:/opt/eucalyptus/var/log/eucalyptus]grep DnsResolver: *

Installed Packages
